profile.name: bc-CareTeam
profile.description: A CareTeam profile describing the involvement of (other) care providers in the care of a patient and her child.

profile.name: bc-observation-percentile
profile.description: Extension on Observation.interpretation describing the percentile of the Observation

profile.name: bc-TransactionComposition
profile.description: A Composition profile describing the Composition resource that should be present in the Transaction Bundle as defined by BabyConnect. The Composition resource should include entries for each resource that is included in the transaction.

profile.name: bc-BirthObservation
profile.description: An Observation profile describing birth-related Observations, such as parturition type, as defined by BabyConnect. Birth-related Observations are Observations about a birth, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). They are also about the mother, which still is the subject of the Observation.

profile.name: bc-riskassessment-software
profile.description: Extension on RiskAssessment describing the software used for the assessment

profile.name: bc-PregnancyUltraSound
profile.description: A DiagnosticReport profile describing a pregnancy ultrasound as defined by BabyConnect. The DiagnosticReport groups Observations related to the pregnancy ultrasound.

profile.name: bc-Pregnancy-TermDate
profile.description: An Observation profile describing term date as defined by BabyConnect. The term date is related to a pregnancy, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). It is also about the mother, which still is the subject of the Observation.

profile.name: bc-patient-birthSex
profile.description: Extension on (child) Patient describing the medical gender (note that Patient.gender is used for the administrative gender).

profile.name: bc-Child
profile.description: A Patient profile for the child Patient as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-encounter-arrival
profile.description: Extension on Encounter.participant describing the period of arrival of the participant

profile.name: bc-DigitalVaginalExamination
profile.description: A DiagnosticReport profile describing a digital vaginal examination as defined by BabyConnect. The DiagnosticReport groups Observations related to the digital vaginal examination.

profile.name: bc-encounter-patientparticipant
profile.description: This extension adds zib-Patient as a target profile to `Encounter.participant.individual`. Our zib profiles based on Encounter pre-adopt the notion that the subject of the Encounter does not have to be present at the encounter (https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-20479). This creates the need to reference the subject in `Encounter.participant.individual` if the subject is present, where the current FHIR R5 build has already added this option to the renamed `participant.actor`.

profile.name: bc-FetusObservation
profile.description: An Observation profile describing fetus-related Observations in a pregnancy, such as movement and heart action, as defined by BabyConnect. Fetus-related Observations are Observations about a fetus, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). Fetus identification is necessary in these Observations, especially in multiple pregnancy. There are two ways of using this profile depending on the presence of a patient / fetus record for the unborn child: 1. A patient / fetus record is present. The subject of the Observation is the (unborn) child Patient. The focus extension can be left blank. 2. A patient / fetus record is not present. The subject of the Observation is the woman Patient. The focus extension refers to the fetus BodySite.

profile.name: bc-DeliveryProcedure
profile.description: A Procedure profile describing the delivery as defined by BabyConnect. A pregnancy (Procedure.reasonReference) can lead to one delivery Procedure, even in multiple birth. In case of multiple birth, multiple birth Procedures will point to the same delivery Procedure. The mother Patient is the subject of the delivery Procedure (Procedure.subject).

profile.name: bc-DeliveryObservation
profile.description: An Observation profile describing delivery-related Observations, such as onset of first stage of labor, as defined by BabyConnect. Delivery-related Observations are Observations about a delivery, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). They are also about the mother, which still is the subject of the Observation.

profile.name: bc-ClinicalImpression
profile.description: A ClinicalImpression profile describing the caregiver's professional assessment around the woman's pregnancy as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-MaternalObservation
profile.description: An Observation profile describing patient-related Observations, which are not captured in other existing profiles, as defined by BabyConnect. Patient-related Observations are about the (pregnant) woman, which is the subject of the Observation.

profile.name: bc-CarePlan
profile.description: A CarePlan profile describing the care arrangement between a pregnant woman and her caregiver(s) as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-AbilityToTakeCareOfChild
profile.description: An Observation profile describing the woman's ability to take care of her child as defined by BabyConnect. Patient-related Observations are about the (pregnant) woman, which is the subject of the Observation.

profile.name: bc-AmnioticFluid
profile.description: An Observation profile describing the amniotic fluid as defined by BabyConnect. Fetus-related Observations are Observations about a fetus, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). Fetus identification is necessary in these Observations, especially in multiple pregnancy. There are two ways of using this profile depending on the presence of a patient / fetus record for the unborn child: 1. A patient / fetus record is present. The subject of the Observation is the (unborn) child Patient. The focus extension can be left blank. 2. A patient / fetus record is not present. The subject of the Observation is the woman Patient. The focus extension refers to the fetus BodySite.

profile.name: bc-Birth
profile.description: A Procedure profile describing the birth of a child as defined by BabyConnect. A birth is related to a delivery Procedure (Procedure.partOf), the child (Procedure.subject) and the pregnancy (Procedure.reasonReference). A pregnancy can lead to one delivery Procedure and one or multiple birth Procedures. In multiple birth, multiple birth instances point to the same delivery Procedure. A birth also provides the relation between a child and its mother: The mother Patient is the subject of the delivery Procedure and the child Patient is the subject of the birth Procedure.

profile.name: bc-BirthControl
profile.description: An Observation profile describing birth control as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-bodysite-child
profile.description: Extension on the BodySite resource to link the (fetus) BodySite to the (child) Patient.

profile.name: bc-ChildBirthAssistance
profile.description: An Encounter profile describing assistance to a woman in labor as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-ChildRecord
profile.description: An EpisodeOfCare profile describing the child care record as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-DisorderOfChild
profile.description: A Condition profile describing child disorders, such as chromosomal and congenital abnormalities or other problems, as defined by BabyConnect. The subject is either the child Patient (in case the child is born or a fetal patient record is in place) or the woman Patient (in case the child is unborn and there is no fetal patient record in place). In the second case, use the bodySite reference extension to refer to the fetus.

profile.name: bc-Donor
profile.description: A RelatedPerson profile describing donor characteristics as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-Encounter
profile.description: An Encounter profile describing birthcare related encounters as defined by BabyConnect. Encounter.type specifies the type of encounter, e.g. prenatal visit, postnatal follow up or counseling.

profile.name: bc-FamilyMemberHistory
profile.description: A FamilyMemberHistory profile as defined by BabyConnect describing the relevant family history of a pregnant woman.

profile.name: bc-familymemberhistory-contributedToDeath
profile.description: Focus on an Observation.\nExtension is mocked from the offical HL7 core of Observation in R4 FHIR build specification at 13-05-2019.

profile.name: bc-FamilySituationAssessment
profile.description: An Observation profile as defined by BabyConnect describing the assessment of the family situation of a pregnant woman. Indications for additional care may be based on this assessment.

profile.name: bc-FeedingPatternInfant
profile.description: An Observation profile describing the infant's feeding pattern as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-Fetus
profile.description: A BodySite profile referring to the unborn fetus when no fetal record (yet) exists as defined by BabyConnect. In case a fetal record is created the unborn fetus will be registered as a Patient.

profile.name: bc-IndividualCareplan
profile.description: A CarePlan profile describing the individual care plan of a pregnant woman as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-IndividualCarePlan-Goal
profile.description: A Goal profile describing the goal(s) of an individual care plan of a pregnant woman as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-InfantExcretion
profile.description: An Observation profile describing a newborn's fecal and urine excretion as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-LegalSituation-LegalStatus
profile.description: A Condition profile describing legal status as defined by BabyConnect. The legal status indicates the basis on which the patient is staying in a healthcare organization. This can be either voluntary or involuntary, however the legal status is always determined by a judge.

profile.name: bc-LegalSituation-Representation
profile.description: A Condition profile describing legal representation as defined by BabyConnect. Representation is important in situations where a person is legally not competent to give permission and/or factually (partly) incapable of doing so. A representative supports and takes decisions in the interest of the representee when they cannot do so themselves (temporarily or permanently).

profile.name: bc-MultidisciplinaryTeamMeeting
profile.description: An Encounter profile describing a team care conference as defined by BabyConnect. In a team care conference caregivers discuss patient cases in absence of the patient.

profile.name: bc-ParentEducationLevel
profile.description: An Observation profile describing a child parent's education level as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-PerinatalDeath
profile.description: An Observation profile describing perinatal and (early) neonatal death as defined by BabyConnect. The subject may be either an unborn, stillborn or living born child. In case of an unborn or stillborn child, a patient or fetus record may not be present. In this case the subject is the woman Patient. Use the focus extension to refer to the fetus BodySite. In all other cases the subject is the child Patient and the focus extension can be left blank.

profile.name: bc-PerinealAssessment
profile.description: An Observation profile describing the perineal assessment as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-PlacentaLocalization
profile.description: An Observation profile describing the localization of the placenta as defined by BabyConnect. Fetus-related Observations are Observations about a fetus, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). Fetus identification is necessary in these Observations, especially in multiple pregnancy. There are two ways of using this profile depending on the presence of a patient / fetus record for the unborn child: 1. A patient / fetus record is present. The subject of the Observation is the (unborn) child Patient. The focus extension can be left blank. 2. A patient / fetus record is not present. The subject of the Observation is the woman Patient. The focus extension refers to the fetus BodySite.

profile.name: bc-PractitionerRole
profile.description: A PractitionerRole profile describing the role of a practitioner as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-PregnancyUltraSoundGeneralFindings
profile.description: An Observation profile describing general ultrasound findings for the fetus as defined by BabyConnect. Fetus-related Observations are Observations about a fetus, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). Fetus identification is necessary in these Observations, especially in multiple pregnancy. There are two ways of using this profile depending on the presence of a patient / fetus record for the unborn child: 1. A patient / fetus record is present. The subject of the Observation is the (unborn) child Patient. The focus extension can be left blank. 2. A patient / fetus record is not present. The subject of the Observation is the woman Patient. The focus extension refers to the fetus BodySite.

profile.name: bc-procedure-decisionMoment
profile.description: Extension on Procedure describing which moment the decision is made for the procedure

profile.name: bc-ProcedureObservation
profile.description: An Observation profile describing procedure-related Observations as defined by BabyConnect. Procedure-related Observations are Observations about a procedure, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). They are also about the mother, which still is the subject of the Observation. For example, embryo transfer date and oocyte retrieval date are observations related to an IVF/ICSI procedure.

profile.name: bc-referralrequest-periodOfTransfer
profile.description: Extension on ReferralRequest describing the perinatal period of transfer

profile.name: bc-referralrequest-requesterSpecialty
profile.description: Extension on ReferralRequest.requester to describe the specialty of the referring organization/practitioner

profile.name: bc-SelfReliance
profile.description: An Observation profile describing self-reliance of the woman after birth as defined by BabyConnect. The subject is the woman Patient.

profile.name: bc-TreatmentDirective
profile.description: A Consent profile as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-UmbilicalCord
profile.description: An Observation profile describing the umbilical cord a as defined by BabyConnect. Fetus-related Observations are Observations about a fetus, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). Fetus identification is necessary in these Observations, especially in multiple pregnancy. There are two ways of using this profile depending on the presence of a patient / fetus record for the unborn child: 1. A patient / fetus record is present. The subject of the Observation is the (unborn) child Patient. The focus extension can be left blank. 2. A patient / fetus record is not present. The subject of the Observation is the woman Patient. The focus extension refers to the fetus BodySite.

profile.name: bc-UterusActivity
profile.description: An Observation profile derived from the maternal Observation profile describing uterus activity as defined by BabyConnect. Uterus activity is a patient-related Observation. Patient-related Observations are about the (pregnant) woman, which is the subject of the Observation.

profile.name: bc-Woman
profile.description: A Patient profile describing the woman who is or was pregnant as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-clinicalimpression-procedure
profile.description: Extension on ClinicalImpression.investigation.item referring to the medical investigation Procedure.

profile.name: bc-ReferralRequest
profile.description: A ReferralRequest profile describing referral details as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-PregnancyObservation
profile.description:
Pregnancy-related Observations are Observations about a pregnancy, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). They are also about the mother, which still is the subject of the Observation.
An Observation profile describing pregnancy-related Observations, as defined by BabyConnect. Observations such as gravidity and parity do not (only) pertain to the Patient but also to a particular pregnancy. - Pregnancy-related Observations use the focus extension to point to the Condition they are about. Without this, all gravidities would only be Observations about a Patient. - Pregnancy-related Observations refer to the EpisodeOfCare with Observation.context.reference
Pattern: [Pregnancy-related Observation | https://informatiestandaarden.nictiz.nl/wiki/Gebz:V1.1_FHIR_IG_bc-PregnancyObservation]

profile.name: bc-ObstetricProcedure
profile.description: A Procedure profile describing obstetric procedures, such as vacuum delivery, as defined by BabyConnect. Obstetric procedures may be related to the pregnancy (reasonReference), birth or delivery (part of). Child-related obstetric procedures are part of a birth Procedure, while mother-related obstetric procedures are part of the delivery Procedure.

profile.name: bc-multidisciplinaryteammeeting-intenttreatment
profile.description: The concept IntentTreatment [zib MultidisciplinaryTeamMeeting v1.0(2020EN)](https://zibs.nl/wiki/MultidisciplinaryTeamMeeting-v1.0(2020EN)) cannot be properly mapped in the CarePlan resource, hence a custom extension is used.

profile.name: bc-clinicalimpression-management
profile.description: Extension on ClinicalImpression describing the decided course of action i.e. clinical management based on the professional assessment.

profile.name: bc-MotherOf
profile.description: A RelatedPerson profile describing the relation between mother and child as defined by BabyConnect. The RelatedPerson is the mother, which is a related person of the child Patient (RelatedPerson.patient). The mother Patient (bc-Woman) is linked to the RelatedPerson (Patient.link of type seealso).

profile.name: bc-procedure-success
profile.description: Extension on Procedure describing whether the procedure was successfull or not

profile.name: bc-CarePlan-InvolvedParties
profile.description: A CareTeam profile describing the involved parties in the care arrangement between a pregnant woman and her caregiver(s) as defined by BabyConnect.

profile.name: bc-ChildObservation
profile.description: An Observation profile describing child-related Observations, which are not captured in other existing profiles, as defined by BabyConnect. Child-related Observations are about the child, which is the subject of the Observation. If the child is unborn and no patient record exists for the child, bc-FetusObservation should be used instead.

profile.name: bc-MaternalRecord
profile.description: An EpisodeOfCare profile describing a maternal record (or pregnancy file) as defined by BabyConnect. The maternal record defines care responsibility for a specific period of time and groups all data related to this period of care: 1. The (overarching) maternal record groups all data related to one pregnancy (.type = 364320009) 2. A sub record groups all data related to a specific perinatal period within the pregnancy (.type contains a code for the perinatal period and .partOf contains a reference to the overarching maternal record)

profile.name: bc-condition-onsetInstitution
profile.description: Extension on Condition to describe the institution where the problem started

profile.name: bc-DisorderOfPregnancy
profile.description: A Condition profile describing disorders related to a pregnancy as defined by BabyConnect. These disorders are part of the pregnancy, which is defined in the part of extension.

profile.name: bc-FetalMonitoring
profile.description: An Observation profile derived from the fetus Observation profile describing fetal monitoring as defined by BabyConnect. Fetal monitoring is a fetus-related Observation. Fetus-related Observations are Observations about a fetus, which is the focus of the Observation (extension). Fetus identification is necessary in these Observations, especially in multiple pregnancy. There are two ways of using this profile depending on the presence of a patient / fetus record for the unborn child: 1. A patient / fetus record is present. The subject of the Observation is the (unborn) child Patient. The focus extension can be left blank. 2. A patient / fetus record is not present. The subject of the Observation is the woman Patient. The focus extension refers to the fetus BodySite.

profile.name: bc-DisorderOfLaborAndDelivery
profile.description: A Condition profile describing post partum disorders or complications as defined by BabyConnect. These disorders are part of the delivery, which is defined in the part of extension.

profile.name: bc-DisorderPostPartum
profile.description: A Condition profile describing post partum disorders or complications as defined by BabyConnect. These disorders are related to the delivery, which is defined in the part of extension.

profile.name: bc-patient-ethnicity
profile.description: Extension on (woman) Patient describing the ethnicity of a patient

profile.name: RiskAssessment focus
profile.description: Focus on a RiskAssessment

profile.name: concept-comments
profile.description: A comment that explains how this code is used in this context (where the value set is expected to be used).

profile.name: workflow-episodeOfCare
profile.description: The episode(s) of care that establishes the context for this {{title}}.
